alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 9:49PM EST until January 15 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Massachusetts... Nashua River At East Pepperell affecting Hillsborough, Worcester and Middlesex Counties. For the Nashua River...including East Pepperell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nashua River at East Pepperell. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding is likely along the river from East Pepperell downstream through Hollis. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Sunday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM EST Sunday was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1000 AM EST.
